attributes.comment:
1. I understand there is pressure to increase fees, but your proposed amounts
are way too much too fast.

2. Increased scrutiny and checking time obviously costs more. But this is a
U.S. security decision that immigration petitioners (and indirectly U.S. citizen
sponsors) should not be burdened to mostly bear. I believe it is fair for
taxpayers to share much of this burden, as the fee increases are way too steep.

3. Also, additional department costs, such as refugee surcharges that have
nothing to do with immigrant fees for specific purposes. Fees should not be
increased for these reasons.

4. Shortening processing times a couple months is no justification for
increasing fees. Give me the slightly processing time and much lower fees
please. Besides increasing efficiencies on your end should result in reduced costs.

5. Most important, your waiver plan eligibility requirements require increased
work on the petitioner end, is in some ways is at odds with sponsorship
financial requirements, and will have the clear effect of discouraging rather
than encouraging legal immigration.

** This fee increase clearly punishes those who want to follow the legal
immigrant path. Wake up people!!
Doug Rigby
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Douglas B. Rigby
